subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
In the bronze script, it was written as {{zh-l|𢼜}}, a {{Han compound|亦|攴|ls=psc|c1=p|c2=s|t2=hand holding a stick|nocap=1}}. In later scripts, the phonetic component was replaced with {{och-l|赤}}.

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text: [[exoactive|Exoactive]] ([[causative]]) of {{och-l|釋|to unloose; to release}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}). Also related to {{och-l|舍|to let off|id=1}} ({{zh-ref|Wang, 1982}}), of which there exists a derived reading {{och-l|舍|to let off; to liberate|id=2}} that formed a variant relationship with {{och-l|赦}}, despite not having the same pronunciation in Old Chinese (*''-aːs'' vs *''-ags'').

subSections.title: Compounds
subSections.text: {{zh-der|恩赦|三赦|十惡不赦|大赦|大赦天下|放赦|特赦|獨角赦書|特赦令|曲赦|赦宥|赦書|罪不可赦|赦免|赦罪|肆赦|赦文|貰赦}}
